basics.name: Dragan Kovacevic
basics.label: Computer Science Professional
basics.summary:
Over 7 years of robust IT industry experience, including 4+ years of experience in DevOps, cloud, and automation roles. A 
          results-oriented engineer with a dynamic blend of experience specializing in Azure DevOps and cloud automation. Excellent 
          communication and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to translate highly complex tasks into actionable plans. 
          Dedicated to growth and development, leads by example, and fosters innovation in collaborative environments.
          • Proficient in multiple programming languages (Python, Java, C#, SQL) and advanced technologies (Azure, 
          Kubernetes, Docker, AI & Machine Learning, Selenium). 
          • Proven track record in CI/CD, QA analysis, optimizing processes, and ensuring seamless application functionality 
          across platforms.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
